decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (543-PL02-041, 543-02-G01_A3, 543-02-R01_A3, 543-02-021_A3, 543-02-022_A3, 543-PL02-00-001_A3 Rev. B, 543-PL02-021 Rev. B, 543-PL02-022 Rev. B, 543-PL02-G01 Rev. C, 543-PL02-R01 Rev. C, 543-PL02-031 Rev. C, Design and Access Statement Rev. C. Received: 12/10/2017. 543-PL02-00-003_A3 Rev. C Received: 14/12/2017) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 4 - Separate access to the residential accommodation on the upper floors of the premises shall be available to residents at all times.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 6 - The windows formed in the flank elevation shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 7 - No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the flats are occupied. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
Condition : 8 - The development shall not be occupied until the existing access to the site is closed and reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 9 - A splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of the access, the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected within the areas of such splays.

Condition : 10 - The car parking accommodation shown on drawing 543-PL02-00-003_A3 Rev. C Received: 14/12/2017 shall be provided before the dwelling to which it relates is occupied and thereafter it shall not be used for any purpose other than the parking of vehicles.

Condition : 11 - Before the dwellings hereby approved are first occupied, the developer shall provide to each dwelling the type of containers required at the time of development for household use for the storage and collection of recyclable materials for the purposes of the Council's kerbside recycling service together with the a refuse storage bin all to the specification then in use by the local authority's recycling collection service (or to such other specification as shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority) and shall notify the Council's refuse and recycling services when the development is first occupied.  The waste and recyclable materials containers shall be stored in a proprietary refuse bin enclosure designed for the purpose to be supplied by the developer in the location shown on the approved plans.
Condition : 12 - No waste and recycling bins shall be left outside the building at any time other than for collection.

Condition : 13 - Before the use hereby approved commences, full details (including manufacturers' specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling Design Standards in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
description: Formation of new entrance to flat by replacing ground floor window on the front elevation of the side extension to match existing entrance to dentist surgery; Alteration to ground floor dwelling to convert into a one bedroom dwelling; Rotate existing external stairs by ninety degrees, with privacy screen mounted to open side; Removal of the existing rear first floor extension adjacent to Widmer Court; Replace existing single rear dormer across width of building with three smaller dormers; Removal of side dorm facing No. 59 and conversion of side hip roof to gable end; Introduction of rooflights; Internal alterations to reduce existing five apartments to  four
